column4: can anyone suggest a good easy to use buttorrent client for ubuntu (except the resource hungry azureus)?
ok
what is wine, and how do i install it?
runs windows programs? wow!
okay :)
sure
just for reference, what is CLI? and what is 'synaptics'?
command line interface
CLI is where you type in commands, rather than the GUI where you can use a mouse
omg a command line bittorrent program? you mean the one with no GUI?
right
that will be very difficult to use
I use a CLI bittorrent program too :-)
for fun you could try it if you wanted
is synaptic to be used to install ALL kinds of software on ubuntu?
it's not that hard.  you save the torrent file in your home directory say, the run konsole, then type in "rtorrent  nameoffile.torrent"
and that's it.
another question, what's repositories?
the official ubuntu software distributions?
it's where you get programs from
right
